sub_title: Senior Software Design Engineer at ASML (C++|Python|Linux)| Ex-Philips | Ex- Honeywell | Ex-Siemens
summary:
Software Developer with 11+ years of experience in the Product development and Embedded industry. Specialized in the field of C++ development projects. worked on agile development process and various phases of SDLC which includes Requirement Analysis, Design and Development, Software testing, Integration Testing, Deliveries and maintenance. 

Intensively worked on embedded development using C, C++ with STL, Qt, python scripting etc. Also worked as a System Integrator wherein he has the responsibility to automate the Continuous Integration and Continuous Development pipeline using Jenkins. Working knowledge of CAN Bus, ARINC 429. worked on ARM processor, X86 Processor, TI f28XX, MPC565 and MPC5554 series processors. 

Efficient in Designing Software using OOAD techniques (UML, Design patterns), 

Technical leadership skills which include mentoring teammates, managing team, guiding reviewing and tracking team activities. 

Domain knowledge of aerospace, automotive, embedded, Industrial automation, healthcare and semiconductor.

school.name: Zinc Smelter Senior Secondary School, Visakhapatnam

certifications.name: Robust Qt & C++ Gui Programming: 2D Graphics
Green Belt Design For Six Sigma

contributors.headline: Senior Software Design Engineer at ASML (C++|Python|Linux)| Ex-Philips | Ex- Honeywell | Ex-Siemens

profile_positions.description:
Project: TomTom PSA KP1 (Sogeti)
Role: Integrator
September 2018 – November 2019

Results: 
Suprabhat has the following roles and responsibility as an Integrator.
o	He has successfully created a development pipeline for KP1 Project considering the full product cycle in mind.
o	He has created the Jenkins master and slave instances in Open stack for the Pipeline.
o	He has created Jenkins Files adding Commit stage, Quality stage, Test Stage so that the pipeline is automatically triggered in each code check-ins.
o	He has created artifactories in JFrog to store the project binaries (APKs).
o	He is involved in maintaining the KP1 main branch and to troubleshoot any issues in integration pipeline.
o	He is involved in reviewing all the check-ins and make sure it merges to main branch after verifying all the merge checks.
o	He has set up a local Slave machine in India to ease the process of night build in local servers.
o	He has been involved in the Project Initiation Phase where he had to travel to Eindhoven, NL to understand the process and successfully completed the initial pipeline setup.
o	He has got recognition from Client for completing tasks proactively and setting up the pipeline.



Project : Cymer (ASML)
Domain  : Semiconductor
Client	: ASML
Worked : Sep '17 to Aug '18
Role: Senior Developer
Responsibilities: 
                1. Writing the Software Impact Analysis(SIA) document for the open issues in ASML issue 
                     resolution tool(AIR).
		2. Implementing the code using C++ and Python Programming Language.
		3. Writing Python Scripting for doing Unit testing and Component Testing.
		4. Creating Devbench in MSC(Master Controller) for testing.
		5. Moderating the offshore reviews and making sure the quality is never compromised.
		6. Taking participation in Client Meetings/Discussion on behalf of offshore team.
		7. Mentoring new joiners about ASML process and Semiconductor domain.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Project Description:
Intellibridge System a.k.a IBS is a system used to transfer data from 3rd party devices for documentation e.g. PIIC iX and ICCA (Philips proprietary tools). It normally helps to communicate between no Philips medical devices and Philips Central Monitoring System.

Your roles / responsibilities (IN DETAIL) in the project	: 
•	Contact the Device manufacturer and get the protocol specifications.
•	Understand the protocol specification document and list out all the necessary parameters, baud rate, parity bits, message format etc.
•	Solder and design the EC5 wire by following the wiring diagram mentioned in protocol specification which need to be used for connecting the device to the Hub.
•	Design the SRS document and send it for review across Bangalore and Andover, US team.
•	Start coding in C++ in Eclipse IDE in Linux environment.
•	Request for code review among all teammates across Bangalore and Andover, US.
•	Close the Driver Development
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Project Description: 
All SIMATIC HMI Comfort Panels consistently offer the same high-end functionality. Featuring high resolution wide-screen displays from 4“to 22“, optionally with touch or key operation, they can be optimally adjusted to any application. Furthermore, they offer numerous innovations.
Comfort Panels are configured using the SIMATIC WinCC Comfort Engineering Software of the new Totally Integrated Automation Portal.

Your roles / responsibilities (IN DETAIL) in the project	: 

•	My detailed tasks are to perform and guide team members to do Requirement analysis of HMI Comfort Panel V14 RT (RunTime) Requirements provided by the HMI Panel engineering team located in Siemens, Germany. 
•	Involved in Complete Software Lifecycle starting from Analysis of the requirement for the feature development to Code Implementation till Development Testing.
•	Responsible for creating Projects using TIA (Total Integration Automation) tool for Simulating it and downloading onto devices
•	Responsible for fixing bugs with higher severity raised by Integration Testing Team.
•	Responsible for Device Debugging using Visual Studio Remote Debugger and solving the memory leak using Intel Inspector and Visual Leak Detector.
•	Mentoring the newcomers on the architecture of WinCC Comfort Panels software and its interface as well as providing module knowledge.
